meanings.definition: To strip (something) of its covering or surface layer.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind can denude the trees of their leaves in the fall.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers will denude the old building of its paint before repainting it.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally denude the cake of its frosting while trying to add more decorations.
meanings.sent4: The artist's emotional performance seemed to denude the audience of their pretenses.
meanings.sent5: The harsh winter frost can denude the garden of all its colorful flowers, leaving it barren.

meanings.definition: To make bare or expose by removing covering or protection.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists carefully denude the ancient artifacts to reveal their true beauty.
meanings.sent2: The storm's strong winds can denude the roof of a house, leaving it vulnerable to rain.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to denude the table of all its decorations in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her heartfelt speech seemed to denude the audience of their doubts and fears.
meanings.sent5: The harsh sunlight can denude the skin of its protective oils, causing dryness and damage.
